metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22038 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 due to a memory leak in the ff_v4l2_m2m_create_context function in v4l2_m2m.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter8 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil57 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample4 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale6 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
